summary: This document is an email chain from April 2020 regarding the weekly Epstein Significant Activity Report (SAR). It contains a forwarded message from August 2019 providing a status update on victim outreach and services offered by the FBI's Victim Services Division, detailing the number of victims contacted and the types of services provided.

persons.name: SSA - FBI New York
persons.context: Appears as the recipient and sender of emails regarding the Epstein Significant Activity Report, coordinating victim information updates.

events.title: Victim Services Status Update
events.description: An internal FBI update reports that 24 victims have been spoken to and offered services (17 in New York, 7 in Miami), with 5 more in process. Services included interview assistance, crisis counseling, media information, and counseling referrals.

events.title: Follow-up on Victim Status
events.description: An email inquiry asks for a status update on victims for the week, indicating ongoing weekly reporting requirements.

events.title: Weekly SAR Request Forwarded
events.description: An email forwards the August 2019 victim status update in response to a request for the weekly Epstein Significant Activity Report, confirming the ongoing need for weekly updates.

keyFacts: As of August 15, 2019, the FBI's Victim Services Division had spoken to and offered services to 24 victims related to the Epstein case (17 in New York, 7 in Miami).
Services offered to victims included interview assistance, crisis counseling, talking to the media information, and counseling referrals.
The FBI was in the process of coordinating services for 5 more victims at that time, with two in Miami, one in New York, and two on the West Coast.
The document establishes a requirement for a weekly Epstein Significant Activity Report (SAR) to track victim outreach and services.
The email chain shows ongoing coordination within the FBI's New York office, specifically Squad C-20 (Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking), regarding victim assistance efforts in 2019-2020.
